alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 10:18PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knott, southeastern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1018 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Demo, or 12 miles east of Hindman, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... East McDowell and Melvin around 1025 PM EDT. Craynor, Beaver, Buckhorn Hollow, Ligon and Blue Moon around 1030 PM EDT. Galveston, Grethel, Honaker and Virgie around 1035 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Osborn, Boldman, Aluba, Harold, Pikeville, Coal Run Village and Coal Run. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
